content:
All of the tenant stuff related to corporate office365 subscription and is managed on the web site. It has nothing to do with local administrator access.

If you are a simple hotmail customer like me; You ensure your server is correctly set. (name wise. It is now a 365 server name. Place Thunderbird in offline mode by clicking the ((o)) in the bottom left on the status bar Restart Thunderbird and change the authentication method of oauth. Return Thunderbird to online mode

Thaty way there are no failed authentication attempts connected to the restart.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Thanks Benoit.

It looks like this is/was an add-on? https://www.antidote.info/en/antidote-10/documentation/user-guide/using-with-your-other-software/mac/firefox-thunderbird-postbox

You will want to check with the authors of Antidote, who may need to adjust their code.
creator: wsmwk

content: I am unsure of your issue. POP accounts are local, but not necessarily in Local Folders. The trash folder for POP is, indeed, local but it is part of the POP account. There is a Trash folder in Local Folders in case you delete any messages from message folders there.
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you for responding. I just needed to understand why things are as they are. I am also testing em_Client right now, which has an easy way to hide unwanted Local folders. If I may paraphrase: Even with a POP setup, there are two sections of the nav pane, the email Account folder area higher up, and the Local folder area lower down. An email deleted in the Account area will appear in the Trash folder of the Account area, and an email deleted in the Local area will appear in the Trash folder in the local area. Makes sense. I had thought an email deleted in the account area would go to the local folder Trash because this is POP, not IMAP. I should have just tested that, but did not think of it. I will mark as solved.

content:
Thunderbird 115.12.2 Released June 22, 2024 is the latest update for Tb 115. https://www.thunderbird.net/thunderbird/115.12.2/releasenotes/

The Tb 115.12.0 is not considered a release in that it is not listed on https://www.thunderbird.net/thunderbird/releases/

Since you use Linux, perhaps you were updated by your distro if you are using a package build in package repository and not an official build at https://www.thunderbird.net/download/

There is also the Tb 128.0esr Release https://www.thunderbird.net/thunderbird/128.0esr/releasenotes/ Released July 11, 2024.

content:
Your expectation and reality differ.

I can not help it is folk get an email. clear out all the visible parts and try and repurpose it instead of creating a new email for the new topic. While it is not really mentioned in the support article https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird# Thunderbird threading is based off the references header in the email, not the subject. There are some preferences that can be set in the Config Editor mentioned here https://kb.mozillazine.org/Stop_threading_by_subject I think mail.strict_threading to false is what you are asking for.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: I looked inside those emails and they came from different people, as well as different content. The emails were not 'repurposed' in any way.

content: What I'm trying to do is sort my inbox into folders, and I'm finding emails that are not meant to be in particular folders. I'm sorting the inbox according to sender.
creator: anna.ceguerra

content:
What you have done is exactly what those sending the emails have done when they cleaned up the birdcage so it looked to them like a new email. Obviously I am going to have to explain a lot here in a very short time.

Email are not only what you see, there is a significant amount of information included with the email regarding the conversation it belong to, what server it touched upon in it's delivery path, as well as things like the date etc. I suggest you have a look at the message source of an email. Any email. Ctrl+U will load the source in a window.

Every ermail has a Message-ID: header. The following one is taken from the email the forum send notifying og your response. 

Message-ID: <01010190a938dadc-6397b5f6-7584-435b-a12e-04e5f6898a9a-000000@us-west-2.amazonses.com>

When you click reply that information is transferred to the References header, and if the message is in a long thread appended to the end of all the other references.

This is the relevant headers from another conversation, sandwiched between more familiar items. 

Subject: Re: [tb-planning] Paying for a feature development? Message-Id: <17206297520.Bf538.375496@composer.thunderbird.topicbox.com> In-Reply-To: <82fdaeaf-9b0f-4cee-887a-4bf1c62d71b9@thunderbird.net> References: <17206118460.893F.487154@composer.thunderbird.topicbox.com> <82fdaeaf-9b0f-4cee-887a-4bf1c62d71b9@thunderbird.net> Date: Wed, 10 Jul 2024 12:42:32 -0400

This is what is used to build the conversion thread by default. Content and subject are not a consideration unless you change the default as I told you you could do.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Thanks you for the explanation. I found the Message-ID for two of the unrelated emails in the same thread, and they are different. E.g.

9ef7bc25caa800e93af2f0d505d3d5da@innerwestcreativenetwork.org.au versus XrRB131YSo2QBLCL-3Lr9w@geopod-ismtpd-canary-0

content:
Did you make the change I suggested?

Your last post clearly indicates you are not following the process. If any of those references:, message-Id: or in-reply-to match: the database is going to place the emails in the same thread. Just because they have separate message-id simply means they are separate messages, not that they don't belong in the same thread.

content: It sounds like your index into the message stre is corrupted, so yes you will need to do it for any folder that has issues. Note that if you have an antivirus place an exception in it for the Thunderbird profile folder. That is the root cause of a lot of corruption issues as Thunderbird has large files that the antivirus interrupts the writing of.

content: I will attempt to answer the basics: - in account settings pane, untick the 'compose in HTMLbox - in settings>composition, click to send only plain text - for the font you want, you can download for free at https://brailleinstitute.org/freefont . Install instructions are on that page. - I documented full font setting instructions at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1437527 it is very detailed but I assure you it will do exactly what you want for message text. My example was calibri font and 14 pt. This adjusts message text font, not other fonts. - for line length, click settings>general, scroll down to bottom to 'config editor' and click that. then search for mailnews.wraplength and change number from 72 to 100. - some of what you want may require custom CSS statements, and that is not a skill of mine. Others may also post with other ways to achieve what you need. You may wish to review the hamburger menu in upper right (three horizontal stacked lines icon) for Density and Fontsize adjustments.
creator: davidsk

hmm, someone sends you a message and specifies the line height and font size and you are looking for software to help you manage your dissatisfaction with their choices of fonts and sizes.

Increased font size to 15; unchecked "allow messages to use other fonts" unchecked "use fixed width font for plain text messages"

Only plain text was already set checked use "use paragraph format instead of body text by default"

html message composing was already set to off

mailnews.wraplength is set to 100

Composing window. The line length soft breaks variably between 115 and 150 characters including spaces. The length leads to having to horizontally scroll, or "cmd -" to make the size smaller, or make the compose window larger. I did the latter. I am puzzled why the line breaks at variable characters when the setting is set at 100 characters?

Received messages. Some received messages have lines soft breaking variably between 115 and 150 characters. When printing these fill page width. Other received messages have lines hard breaking at 72 characters. When printing these messages have 72 character lines.

Did I forget any setting? Should anything be set differently?

Is there a way to have the hard wrap 72 characters become a soft wrap, at least when printing, to fill the page width?

EDIT: For some reason the screenshots showed up as broken for me. Tried PNG and JPG. Quit and cleared cache and cookies, now shows up, at least for me.

content: La password viene annullata dal server. Dovresti sentire Aruba per sapere perché accade.
creator: @next

content:
ho risolto così: al fine di correggere tale errore la invito ad aggiornare la password sia sul server di posta in arrivo che su quello di posta in uscita.

Per poter cambiare la password sul suo programma di posta Mozilla Thunderbird le suggerisco di seguire i passaggi sotto riportati:

cliccare sull'ingranaggio in basso a sinistra (1) o su Strumenti (1) nella barra in alto e poi su Impostazioni (2):


selezionare Privacy e sicurezza (3) nel menu a sinistra:


cliccare su Password salvate...


Inserire nella barra di ricerca il nome della casella PEC (5), cliccare sui Mostra password (6) e nel pop up scegliere Si (7). Cliccare con il pulsante destro sulla password relativa all'IMAP/POP3 (8) ed inserire la nuova password. Eseguire la medesima operazione per l'SMTP (9). Infine cliccare su Chiudi (10).


In ultimo le suggerisco di tentare un auto-invio per verificare il corretto funzionamento.

content: From your description, the issue may just be a slow, intermittent, internet connection. I have a particular email account that does the same thing, saving sometimes and sometimes not. The error message's words, as I recall, may be exactly the issue. All Thunderbird can do is take your message and 'toss' it to the server, but it's up to the server to 'catch' it. I do appreciate the frustration, but knowing how to troubleshoot an internet connection is far beyond my few talents.

content:
Yes ,these are already enabled. We have 2 domains operational with same environment. One domain is working well.

2nd Domain has almost 500 systems with thunderbird client and mailbox in Exchange online. The issue is happening only in this domain and with selective users.

We tried configuring profile of a working mailbox in a system where the mailbox configured is not working. In this scenario, working mailbox continued to work along with the mailbox which was not working. So it doesnt seem to be issue with client as such. We tested the scenario otherway round. by configuring non working email in a working system where mail is working. There also the non working mailbox does not download emails, though the working email continued to download mails.

Note : We received an information from one of the other customer organization who uses thunderbird client with pop3 that for them as well the mails stopped downloading since last 2-3 days and they are also running behind microsoft for checking the same.

content: Please continue in https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1452037 so that we have one location for this issue.
creator: wsmwk

content:
You look for what again? Unless you have composed an email then there is nothing to send and clicking send, sends the email immediately. There for the is no purpose having a send receive button as there is nothing ever to send unless you specifically go out of your way to use the shortcut keystroke to send later (Ctrl+Shift+Enter). Those that use the outbox to queue mail generally just right click the outbox folder and select send unsent messages.

There is a get mail button offered in the toolbar and also visible in the header of the folder pane. (beside the big blue +New Message button.) It looks like a cloud for some reason.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: As so often in IT, there is tripping up over terminology, i.e. different wording for stating the same underlying concept. I used the phrase "Send-Receive" in my question because that is the name of a specific Outlook 2016 client button that I have used for many years for both sending and receiving, so it was very much in my head as the words to use. To shorten my question, I had previously edited out the following: "The context is for example expecting an email to arrive momentarily, e.g. promised immediately on the phone to me by someone just now." I should have left that in my question to indicate that the focus is 100% on the Receive in Send-Receive. My error, over-editing. You solved my problem by pointing out "Get Message", which is in effect the same concept as "Receive" in Outlook 2016 desktop. I just could not easily clear my brain of the familiar wording, a typical issue with changing apps. Thanks for responding. I will mark solved.
creator: Quenchoo

content: I do not know MACs, but you may be able to verify Thunderbird status by clicking the settings>general and looking for a button for update history. Since you are using ver 78, that might be Preferences>general. The text you posted, though, does not indicate an update happened. You can also click Help>about to verify the version number.

content:
Can't run the possibly auto-updated app, so can't check update history. Installed 78.10.1 from a 2021 .dmg. It runs with its own Profile. About profile shows the current profiles and the previous profile from 2 AM when I shut down. However, selecting the previous profile and clicking Launch profile produces an error message says it can only be used with newer versions of Thunderbird.

So, one question is: how do I update 78.10.1 to newer versions without taking the last one which may have created the problem. Alternatively, what could I copy from the previous profile to recover my emails, address book, etc., without triggering an error message...

Many thanks for the help
creator: garth4

content: Is it possible that you were using an older version than 78.10.0 and thunderbird updated to that version? If so, then you would be wanting the prior version, not a later version. Is there a compatibilities.ini file in the preferred profile that you could rename and try again? Run 78.10.1 and click preferences>general and check update history there, as it may tell. If the prior version is needed (78.9.1), the download link is at https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/78.9.1/mac/ I also suggest you verify that auto update is OFF, since you are dependent on the current MAC OS.
creator: davidsk

content:
I'm embarrassed. Turns out the Thunderbird_78_10_0.app name was misleading; left over from an earlier install which was subsequently updated without my changing the name :-(

Get info on the failing app reveals "Thunderbird 128.0esr". I have no idea about the migrations from 78.10.

Following my install of 78.10.1 from a 2021 .dmg, I allowed it to update to 78.14.0, which runs OK. Dragging my Mail folder from the previous Profile into 78.14.0' current Profile, and changing a nested folder name has restored my email - 14 GB worth, phew! Now working on my address books...

The failing Thunderbird app is 434.7 MB, the fresh 78.14.0 is 207 MB. Makes me wonder about file corruption as opposed to a rogue update.

So, I think I'm on the way to recovery. I'll keep you updated.

Many thanks

content: I closed T-bird to clear the icon. I confirmed the setting to be "Badge app icon with Count of unread messages. I all also deleted all the emails in the list, which were test emails. I sent two more test emails from another device and email account. Correctly, the badge on the app icon then was two, for two unread emails. I then read one of those emails, but the badge number is still two. I then sent a third email, and the badge app icon number is now three. So what the badge app icon is reporting in multiple circumstances is the total number of emails in the inbox list, not the number of unread emails. I wonder if this due to being on POP, which I did specify above. Maybe the badge app icon works right only on IMAP. Just speculating on that. [Also, I am puzzled by the option Count of new messages, how "new" is defined. But what is useful to me is a badge count of unread, which I cannot so far make work.]

creator: sfhowes

content: My Thunderbird version is 115.2.12, which is showing on my screen, after requesting an update, as already up to date, as of the early morning of July 13. Maybe updates are rolled out geographically? On Outlook 2016 client, I see a yellow envelope badge to show that a message (or plural) is unread, but no number of messages is provided. A badge accurately showing whether there are any unread messages is highly useful to me, and for me a must-have really on Thunderbird. I want to walk by my computer and see at a glance from maybe three feet away whether I need to sit down and open an unread email. For my needs anyway, the actual number, which is very hard to read really, is not even needed, but the badge indicating unread emails is needed. I hope someone can respond to the questions about the App icon options which I mentioned in an earlier post in this thread. What more specifically does the "Count of new messages" option do? "New" in what sense? Is there a timer for being "new". Or what? It seems intuitive to me that New=Unread and Old=Read, but that can't be the currently intended definition, since the other option is "Count of unread", so the two options would be identical, if "new" = "unread". The main practical problem in my view is that in Thunderbird POP the badge does not go away after all unread emails are read. This may be because the number count of unread does not go down when each email is read. So the number count cannot terminate at zero unread, which presumably is the trigger for making badge icon go away. So if the number decrementing is too much for POP, that would explain why the badge itself will not go away on POP, even though all emails have been read. This for me and likely some others is a big problem, even keeping me from choosing Thunderbird in a comparison with em-Client. I just want to see from the taskbar whether or not all my emails have been read, a binary type report.
creator: Quenchoo

content: I am now on 128 via Thunderbird.net. The setting is Count of Unread Messages. Despite reading all the messages, the badge number went down to one, but it did not go to zero with no unread messages remaining, and the red circle with a 1 did not disappear either. I sent myself from another device and account a second new email, and the badge number went from one to two. I then opened that email, but the badge number stayed at two. I sent a third email, see the gold star on the new one, and the badge number increases to three. But per above, two of those three have been read. So no change with 128 that I can detect. The badge number in a given session goes up with incoming emails, but not down as they are read. Right now I see one unread and two read, with a three on the badge. I read the unread one, and still see three on the badge. So the badge number seems to be stating the total number of received emails in the current session, i. e. since the app has been launched. Maybe the settings name needs correcting, either that or the software operation. My question also stands: What is the other setting, Count of New Messages? For my money, I am getting a count of new messages, with "New" defined as "arriving in the current session and not remove from the Inbox." There is no Count of Unread Messages option in reality. That would be my take. Whether there are bugs or just misnomers in setting names is beyond me.

content: That may mean that, for whatever reason, thunderbird had problems with your profile, so it created a new one. Your old proflle contents are likely still there, but in a different profile. If you click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' you will be in the profile. with mouse click the link in File Explorer to go back one folder so that you are in the Profiles folder. Click there to enter profiles folder and there will probably be two or more profiles. Click into each and then the Imapmail folder and Mail folders to see if your accounts are there. That profile would also have your addressbook. You can attempt to reactivate it by clicking help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down this time to 'Profiles' and click 'about:profiles, click 'create profile' button in upper left, click next, enter a short name to identify the profile, then click the choose button to locate and select that profile.

content:
You will have to download thunderbird-dbg from the repository you linked to BEFORE you can install Thunderbird itself. You may find there are other things you'll need to track down too.

A better bet would be to get it from https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/91.1.2/linux-x86_64/. Choose the language you want and click that then thunderbird-91.1.2.tar.bz2. That is a tar achieve file so when it's downloaded open it and you'll find a folder called thunderbird. Copy that wherever you like. To run it either open that folder with your file manager and click the file called thunderbird. You can also add a custom launcher for it to your menu and/or panel.

content: Do you have the authentication method set to OAuth2 for the outgoing (and also the incoming imap.mail.yahoo.com or pop.mail.yahoo.com)? Remove the entries for the account from Saved Passwords in Settings, restart TB, enter the account (not app) password in the OAuth window to allow access, and an oauth:// token will be stored in Saved Passwords (cookies must be accepted in TB Settings).

content:
Thunderbird is a mail client, so it can only get mail from mail accounts that already exist.

For instance if you are trying to add LouBakerTheFirst@gmail.com, first you need to create that account with google.

Otherwise, it is as simple as selecting new account from the application menu.

content:
re : I also tried running Windows 10 in safe mode but then when I open TB it said there was no network connection.

You would need to use 'SAfe Mode with Networking' and if you normally use wireless connection then you will need to use an ethernet cable to connect to router.

This is the best method of checking whether another program is causing a problem when Thunderbird tries to connect to server.

At this point we do not know anything about your setup. Please post the following information: In Thunderbird Help > Troubleshooting Information Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts' section Copy all the data and post the info into this forum question.

I've seen this 'Check mail server capabilities' occur in the past when people were using a server which was not using up to date tls security. I've also seen issues when people were using STARTTLS instead of SSL/TLS. So post the info stated above so we have a starting point.
creator: Toad-Hall
